summary: After losing nearly $1 trillion in market value, Nvidia now trails Apple and Microsoft . Nvidia has a lot of tailwinds that could fuel growth throughout the remainder of the year . The technology sector has witnessed an abnormal level of interest compared to other industries . The AI theme can largely be traced to asmall concentration of megacap stocks known as the "Magnificent Seven"  As of May 1, Nvidia is the third-largest company in the world measured by market cap . The company's current market cap is nearly $1 trillion lower than peak levels seen in January . The first large-scale sell-off in Nvidia stock happened earlier this year, after a Chinese start-up emerged out of nowhere .  The current sell-off in Nvidia revolves around a nasty storm related to new tariff policies . I see Nvidia as a more critical player to the development of AI-powered services compared to Apple and Microsoft .  As of closing bell on April 30, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, and Alphabet -- each of which works closely with Nvidia -- have reported earnings . Despite a turbulent macroeconomic environment, big tech appears to be confident in the long-run potential of AI .  Nvidia is best positioned among the Magnificent Seven to benefit from AI capex tailwinds . Tech giants are spending tens of billions on data centers, servers, chips, networking equipment, and more . Nvidia should witness strong demand for its GPUs and various other services throughout the second half of the year .  Nvidia: If you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $296,928! Apple:if you invested . $38,933! Netflix: $623,685! Right now is the best time to buy before it’s too late .  The Motley Fool recommends the following options: long January 2026 $395 calls on Microsoft . Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla are among the "Magnificent Seven" stocks .

Many semiconductor stocks slumped this year as President Donald Trump's tariffs, the escalating trade wars, and fears of a recession cast dark clouds over the booming sector . But that pullback has created attractive buying opportunities for investors who expect the semiconductor market to continue growing over the next few decades .  TSMC is the world's largest and most advanced contract chipmaker . Most of the top chipmakers rely on TSMC's foundries to produce their smallest, densest, and most power-efficient chips . In its latest quarter, TSMC generated 59% of its revenue from the high-performance computing (HPC) market .  TSMC remains the linchpin and bellwether of the semiconductor industry . From 2024 to 2027, analysts expect TSMC's revenue and earnings per share to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 21% and 22% . ASML is the largest producer of lithography systems, which are used to optically etch circuit patterns onto silicon wafers .  ASML's dominance in EUV technology gives it nearly unlimited pricing power and an impenetrable moat . Its current-generation "low-NA" EUV systems can produce chips as small as 2nm . Analysts expect the company's revenue and EPS to grow at a CAGR of 12% and 19% in 2024 .  Arm designs power-efficient CPUs that consume less power than x86 for PCs and servers . The chip designs are now used in about 99% of the world's smartphones . Arm licenses those designs to leading mobile chipmakers like Qualcomm, MediaTek, and Apple .  Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing isn't cheap at 55 times forward adjusted earnings . From fiscal 2024 to fiscal 2027, analysts expect revenue to grow at a CAGR of 23% and 81% . Arm's first-party brand recognition could also make it more appealing than third-party chips among OEMs .  Stock Advisor’s total average return is 906% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to164% for the S&P 500 . If you invested $1,000 at the time of our recommendation,you’d have $701,781!

On Monday, Truist upgraded Peloton Interactive Inc. to Buy with a $11 price target . Truist sees Peloton’s stock approaching a point where improving fundamentals can drive a gradual equity recovery .  The analyst team anticipates Peloton’s F3Q25 results to reflect revenue slightly above consensus estimates . While near-term challenges remain, the stock appears largely de-risked, offering a compelling entry point for long-term investors .  Management’s $725 million weight loss revenue target may prove optimistic if users don’t switch to alternatives like Liraglutide or oral medications . HIMS remains uniquely positioned to personalize and democratize healthcare with its scalable, trusted platform .  DA Davidson upgraded Airbnb Inc. to Buy with a $155 price target . DA Davidson highlights the resilience of online leisure travel spend . The brokerage emphasizes Airbnb’s ongoing tech stack development, setting the stage for new product launches .  DA Davidson adds Airbnb to its Best-of-Breed Bison initiative . JPMorgan launched coverage on Western Digital Corporation (NASDAQ:WDC) at Overweight with a $57 price target . JPMorgan notes Western Digital’s successful transition to a pure-play HDD provider following its NAND business separation in February .  WDC delivered strong March-quarter results, surpassing consensus on revenue, margins, and EPS . For the June quarter, WDC forecasts $2.45 billion in revenue, up 7% sequentially . The investment bank highlights WDC’s strong exabyte demand, supported by long-term agreements with hyperscalers .  Rosenblatt downgrades Apple to Neutral, slashing the price target to $217 . For this stock to pop, AI needs to kick iPhone sales into hyperdrive . The analysts’ message? Enjoy the show, but don’t bet the farm. Enjoy show, tread carefully.

Billionaire Warren Buffet has a long history of outperforming the S&P 500 . Buffett's investment inApple Inc. remains his largest stock position in Berkshire Hathaway .  Apple stock is down 15.9% year-to-date in 2025 . Of the five largest stock holdings in Berkshire Hathaway, only one is positive . Chinese automakerBYD CompanyADR(OTC:BYDDY) is up 49.1% and 69.3% over the last year . Buffett currently owns over 54 million shares of BYD valued at $2.7 billion .  Berkshire Hathaway stock is up 19.3% year-to-date, outpacing the -3.0% performance of the SPY . Buffett is now the sixth richest person in the world with a wealth of $166 billion .  BYD is among the world's leaders in electric vehicle sales . In March, BYD was number one in new electric vehicles sales in China . A new production facility in Hungary is expected to produce 200,000 units a year . The company is also considering another factory in the region . The Oracle of Omaha held onto a $20 flip phone even as his Apple investment soared into the tens of billions . You can invest today for just $0.26/share with a $1000 minimum . Back in 2016, Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway started scooping up Apple shares .  Buffett didn't switch to an iPhone until 2020, when Apple's stock price hit a record high . That single stock made up over 40% of Berkshire's equity portfolio .  Buffett, 89, officially switched to an iPhone 11 . He admitted he mostly used it "as a phone" and wasn't diving deep into apps or emoji keyboards . Buffett was already managing one of the largest Apple stakes in the world before ever making a single FaceTime call .  Buffett bought Apple not because he wanted to join the iPhone hype, but because he believed in the business model . Fast forward to 2024, Buffett began trimming that Apple stake . Berkshire retained more than 905 million shares valued at approximately $174 billion . Warren Buffett plans to step down as Berkshire Hathaway chief by the end of the year . JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon said he "represents everything that is good about American capitalism" Apple CEO Tim Cook praised Buffett and his successor, Greg Abel .  Berkshire began buying Apple stock in 2016 and steadily added more shares . While Berkshire sold off more than half of its holdings in Apple stock last year, the iPhone maker remains the single biggest position in its portfolio . Apple CEO Tim Cook also reacted to the surprise announcement .  Only his children who are serving as directors had prior knowledge . CFRA analyst Cathy Seifert said Buffett's decision was probably tough, but that it's better that he leaves on own terms .

Tesla CEO and DOGE master Elon Musk and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent headliners at Milken conference . Rupert Murdoch is also expected to make a rare appearance .  There's more going on with the economy than the 0.3% GDP drop that momentarily hit stocks this week . Tariffs are hurting a lot of companies (including Apple) But it's not hurting others, as conventional wisdom would hold . The best thing I can do is present what the world's top leaders are seeing and hearing .  "We had our best quarter as it relates to sales comps in the last five quarters," CEO says . "We're not seeing a change in the basket [size]. So when they come in, the attach [rate] has been pretty much the same as far as customization or adding on food."  "In general, as a group, among our 45 million clients, there has been a little bit more concern," he says . "We have seen some net equity selling and we have seen sentiment among our clients become more bearish," he adds .  Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor . US tech behemoths that dominate the S&P 500 Index are breathing a sigh of relief as last week’s earnings reports show outlooks remain strong . One after another, tech giants from Amazon.com Inc. to Microsoft Corp. unveiled forecasts that suggest demand remains largely intact for businesses .  The tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 Index took its two-week rally to 10% . Microsoft led gains in the so-called Magnificent Seven megacaps, with its best week in more than two years . Of course, the threat of renewed volatility hangs over tech giants as the trade war drags on .  Big Tech companies have been at the center of the selloff in US stocks that’s shaved about 3% off of the S&P 500 this year . The worry is that tariffs will fan inflation and stifle economic growth . The market got some reassurance on Friday from a strong jobs report and hints of possible trade talks .  Microsoft's revenue forecasts for the current quarter topped expectations thanks in part to strength in its cloud-computing business . Amazon’s operating profit outlook was weaker than expected, but hasn’t “seen any attenuation of demand yet” Nvidia Corp. is scheduled to announce results on May 28 .  Comments sent shares of chipmakers and computing-hardware makers higher . Tesla Inc. backed away from a prior forecast to return to revenue growth in 2025 . Apple said it expects $900 million in higher costs from tariffs in the current quarter .  Gabelli: “There’s certainly a concern that things could get worse, but for the most part it has been pretty positive. things look much better than expected,” Howard said .
